description: Base SRT situation repository - Core leadership and decision-making scenarios

situations.situation: You are leading a team on a critical mission when suddenly your communication equipment fails.
Your junior colleague made a serious mistake that could cost the organization heavily.
You discover that your best friend is involved in unethical activities at work.
During a natural disaster, you must choose between saving equipment or helping injured civilians.
Your senior officer gives you an order that you believe is incorrect and potentially dangerous.
You are assigned a task with insufficient resources and a tight deadline.
Two of your team members are in constant conflict, affecting team performance.
You witness senior officials engaging in corrupt practices.
Your family member is seriously ill, but you have an important operational duty.
You are offered a promotion that requires relocating to a difficult area.
During a rescue operation, you realize that helping one group means leaving another group at risk.
You receive credit for work that was actually done by your team member.
Your unit is surrounded by hostile forces and supplies are running low.
A team member under your command is consistently underperforming despite warnings.
You discover classified information has been leaked from your department.
Your innovative idea is rejected by superiors, but you strongly believe it will work.
During a public gathering, you notice someone behaving suspiciously.
Your colleague takes leave frequently, causing additional burden on the team.
You are blamed for a failure that was caused by circumstances beyond your control.
A local community opposes a project you are implementing for national interest.
You are assigned to work under a junior officer who was recently promoted over you.
During training, you realize a safety protocol is being ignored that could cause accidents.
Your team fails an important evaluation despite your best efforts.
You witness discrimination against a colleague based on their background.
A political figure tries to influence your official decision-making.
Your unit receives outdated equipment while newer units get modern technology.
During a patrol, you encounter civilians in an unauthorized area who claim they are lost.
Your commanding officer asks you to falsify a report to avoid negative consequences.
A fellow officer spreads false rumors about you among colleagues.
You must choose between completing a mission on time or ensuring complete safety of your team.
Your subordinate shares personal problems that are affecting their work performance.
During an emergency, you realize your training is insufficient for the situation at hand.
You are offered a lucrative private sector job while serving in a critical position.
Your proposal for improvement is criticized heavily in front of senior officers.
A team member reveals they have been concealing a medical condition that could affect operations.
You are asked to train new recruits when you feel you need more training yourself.
During a joint exercise, you notice safety violations by another unit.
Your honest feedback about a senior officer is leaked, creating tension.
You must decide between following traditional methods or implementing an untested innovative approach.
A local leader demands preferential treatment for their community during resource distribution.
Your team achieves success but you know it was partly due to luck rather than skill.
During a crisis, multiple people give you conflicting instructions simultaneously.
You discover your predecessor left behind serious unresolved issues in your new assignment.
A media person approaches you for comments on a sensitive organizational matter.
Your unit is asked to work extended hours repeatedly without adequate compensation or recognition.
You witness environmental damage being caused by official activities under your supervision.
A team member consistently takes credit for collective achievements.
During inspection, you find serious deficiencies in your unit that reflect poorly on your leadership.
You are told to compromise on quality to meet a tight deadline for a high-visibility project.
Your family expresses concern about the risks and sacrifices required in your profession.
A subordinate requests leave during a critical phase of operations citing personal emergency.
You notice morale declining in your unit due to unclear communication from higher authorities.
An important delegation visit is scheduled, but your unit is unprepared due to recent challenges.
You are assigned to work with someone you previously had serious disagreements with.
During a border patrol, you encounter individuals crossing illegally who claim to be refugees.
Your innovative training method is questioned by traditionalist seniors despite showing positive results.
You discover that welfare funds meant for junior personnel are being misused.
A team member's family emergency coincides with a crucial phase of your mission.
You are pressured to show favoritism towards certain team members based on their connections.
During extreme weather conditions, you must decide whether to continue operations or seek shelter.
